column4: You got my instructions yesterday? or did your client quit? :(
i reinstalled ubuntu (killed all partitions and remade them), i only installed ubuntu this time
Did you try ctrl-alt-f1 at that black screen?
what are you going to do now?
i really think it has something to do with my graphics card (though i have no arguments/knowledge to back this up)
pop-in the ubuntu live CD and lets do some troubleshooting! :)
boot the liveCD up, and lets see what we can do
please tell me you're still here O_o
open a terminal and type mkdir ~/ubuntuPartition
after that open gparted and see on what HDD and partition ubuntu resides and tell me
Ubuntu is on hda and one 1=first partition right?
i installed in on hda1, and yes, first partition (only partition)
it wrote a qwhole lot of things
Dont worry cd ~/ubuntuPartition then ls Do you see boot?
bash: cd: /home/ubuntu/ubuntuPartition: No such file or directory
it doens't print anything when i do these things, i hope that's right?
ok, did that, it printed a lot of text again, it looks like a help COMMAND thing, it explains how to use the command :/
yes i did, i types ls, and there is nothing
go to cd /media then ls Do you have a ubuntu file?
yes, in a nice shade of blue
cd /ubuntu then ls do you see anything?
it still says ubuntu isn't there
i see a lot of things, want me to type it over?
